answers.text: was the deliberate and systematic murder of millions of Jews and other "unwanted"

qas.question: During what word event did the Holocaust happen?
Who is responsible for the Holocaust?
How did the Nazis conjure up anti-Semitic feelings in civilians?
When did the suffering of the Jews begin?

context: The Holocaust (which roughly means "burnt whole") <a0_0>was the deliberate and systematic murder of millions of Jews and other "unwanted"<a0_0/> <a1_0>during World War II<a1_0/> by the <a2_0>Nazi regime in Germany.<a2_0/> Several differing views exist regarding whether it was intended to occur from the war's beginning, or if the plans for it came about later. Regardless, persecution of Jews extended well <a4_0>before the war even started<a4_0/>, such as in the Kristallnacht (Night of Broken Glass). The Nazis used <a3_0>propaganda<a3_0/> to great effect to stir up anti-Semitic feelings within ordinary Germans.
